qas.question: What was the name of the woman who was allegedly raped in the book?
What is the name of Atticus' client in the rape trial?
Who stopped the mob by shaming them?

context: Judge Taylor appoints Atticus to defend <a1_0>Tom Robinson<a1_0/>, a black man who has been accused of raping a young white woman, <a0_0>Mayella Ewell<a0_0/>. Although many of Maycomb's citizens disapprove, Atticus agrees to defend Tom to the best of his ability. Other children taunt Jem and Scout for Atticus's actions, calling him a "nigger-lover". Scout is tempted to stand up for her father's honor by fighting, even though he has told her not to. Atticus faces a group of men intent on lynching Tom. This danger is averted when <a2_0>Scout, Jem, and Dill<a2_0/> shame the mob into dispersing by forcing them to view the situation from Atticus' and Tom's points of view.
